Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s 1968 Night of the Living Dead spawned remakes, sequels and even an entire franchise for the director. Fans of the title would cross over to the cinematic versions of The Evil Dead, most notably featuring necro-clowns as major antagonists.

Olivier Assayas' film stars Asia Argento as a woman who had a relationship with Michael Madsen. Madsen is a business man who is hiding his clandestine activities by conducting his company's actions through P.O. boxes in an international array of cities. His aura of charm and intelligence has a way of keeping the people he targets unaware of the intent he has on their lives. They begin to realize what is and has been happening when bodies begin turning

Reading through these comments, I see a remarkable socio-cultural clash theme emerging between the US and... the Dutch! The US — a land where anyone from anywhere can pick themselves up, put down roots, start anew, thrive, succeed—in other words, a land of immigrants and opportunity. And one where the taxpayers pay for everything.

The Dutch — a place that values privileged educations, subsidizes foreign workers into top positions

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to the lush tragedies of love and war being played out. The film is a comforting reminder of our complicated but ingenious history and yet it is to Finn’s credit that it is also light hearted and humorous at times and bursts with colour.
Ethan Rutherford
Beautiful scenery and sufficient action but engaging

As kids movie it is great. For the family it just sucks. I was truly hoping for something like the Goonies which is a great film for kids but also great for an adult audience. Instead we get something that may keep kids amused for 90 minutes rather than something that will entertain a whole family for 90 minutes.
The other problem is that there are so many different sub plots that they work out very confusing at times for the kids and also the adults.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures across the galaxy in their space ships, along with their pets, the feral cav dishnows. Alcoholism is the norm on Planet Earth. Yet, the wild cav dishnows affected by alcohol is just not the same.
